solution_line_template: Since Paul makes {trips_per_day} trips per day, and each trip involves going both down and up, this means he travels the full vertical distance of his apartment complex {trips_per_day}*{movements_per_trip}=<<{trips_per_day}*{movements_per_trip}={vertical_movements_per_day}>>{vertical_movements_per_day} times a day.
Since there are {days_in_week} days in a week, this means he makes this trip {vertical_movements_per_day}*{days_in_week}={vertical_movements_per_week} times a week.

Since each story is {story_height_feet} feet tall, that means with {num_stories} stories he travels {num_stories}*{story_height_feet}= <<{num_stories}*{story_height_feet}={feet_per_vertical_movement}>>{feet_per_vertical_movement} feet each trip.

Since he made {vertical_movements_per_week} trips of {feet_per_vertical_movement} feet each, this means he traveled {feet_per_vertical_movement}*{vertical_movements_per_week}= <<{feet_per_vertical_movement}*{vertical_movements_per_week}={total_vertical_distance}>>{total_vertical_distance} feet in a week.
